column5: I have searched around but information on Lake Nipigon can be tough to locate.We are planning on being up there the second week of June, using the Gull Bay launch on the west side. The thought is to head out to the islands off shore to locate a decent spot to camp and then fish as the water conditions allow. Looking for advice, stories or other thoughts? Thanks!!
Moosebunk over on the Ontario Fishing Community boards has posted several great reports from Nipigon. Might try giving him a PM.
Watched a Linder Angling Edge episode where they targeted pike on that lake. Some real hogs! Have fun!
Not sure about the nipigon region but if its like in the northwestetn part there is no non resident camping. Should check that out just in case the mnr stops you.
Not sure if I'd ever leave my vehicle at that launch. Heard some interesting stories...

Are you going to be staying at Brian Kings property? The fishing there can be very very good! Lots of walleye, big brook trout and big lake trout. You will be passing right by my shop. If you need anything dont hesitate to shoot me a Pm!Josh

just go to Onaman River Resort.Fish shore line north and south of river mouth.Very good and easy fishing.Only need some large Johnson Silver Minnows,large Dr. spoons and if you trool, jointed Rapalas and jointed Rebels. their inland lakes are also good for pike and walleyes.Also walleye right at camp in river. Good Fishing Pikeman
Pikeman, did you fish for lake trout while at Onaman?
What weeks have you been there? Thanks

We have not fished for lakers but others at camp have.We have been there first week of June and last week of Aug. Spring is better for Pike on Nipigon because of weed groth.In spring we fish very shallow and close to shore.In the late summer they are as you know they are much deeper and harder to find.Eyes are better later in the river because of suckers spanning and sometimes season opening.River goes by the lake rules up to first falls which is above camp. Good fishing Pikeman
